nodes.title: Account Abstraction: Past, Present, Future
nodes.subtitle: Learn about account abstraction in Ethereum—what it means and why it matters.

nodes.title: When can I withdraw my stake? How do I do it?
nodes.subtitle: Learn more about staking withdrawals with the Shanghai upgrade, and how to use MetaMask Staking to get your ETH back in an account you control.

nodes.title: Buying Crypto in Portfolio Dapp For An Easy Experience, the MetaMask Way
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask’s Buy Crypto aggregator finds a new home in the comprehensive dapp for a simple purchasing journey.

nodes.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: March 2023
nodes.subtitle: If you had to take away just one lesson from March, it would be to remain cautious about airdrops. They have been an integral part of our ecosystem’s culture, but that means they also attract scammers.

nodes.title: Building the Future of Customer Support with MetaMask Activity
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask's cutting-edge Support tool, winner of an internal hackathon, provides contextual help, education and information to users, and gives Support agents the information they need to assist those users.

nodes.title: MetaMask Mobile and Extension updates improve wallet experience with more control and transparency
nodes.subtitle: With its latest updates, MetaMask Mobile improves load times, browser navigation, and account connectivity; MetaMask Extension enhances the onboarding experience with more privacy settings to limit data exposure.

nodes.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: February 2023
nodes.subtitle: It’s a mixed bag this month. We’re happy to share what we’ve been up to, but there are always threats out there. Whether you’re getting blasted by snow storms or relaxing on a sunny beach, we hope you enjoy our February report.

nodes.title: MetaMask Bridges Launches Support For L2 Networks Arbitrum and Optimism
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask Bridges concludes beta phase in stable production environment with L2 support, increased transfer limits, and fee enablement

nodes.title: MetaMask Grants DAO funds Spritely Foundation
nodes.subtitle: Funding a new model for the internet prioritizing security and collaboration.

nodes.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: January 2023
nodes.subtitle: Happy new year! Kick it off right by staying vigilant. This month, we’re looking at address poisoning attacks and read-only reentrancy. And of course, the latest update from the MetaMask Security Laboratory…

nodes.title: Welcome to MetaMask Learn
nodes.subtitle: Learn what web3 is, why it matters, and how to get started with simple lessons and interactive simulations.

nodes.title: What is Staking? How do I do it?
nodes.subtitle: A deep dive into how token lockups and network staking work across web3

nodes.title: The First UX Hackathon In Web3: Building Is Not Just Coding
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask and HOPR teamed up to host the first ever UX hackathon in web3. Here's how it went and what I learned.

nodes.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: December 2022
nodes.subtitle: We’re wrapping up the year with progress updates and stories from the ecosystem. See you all in 2023!

nodes.title: We hosted a group of artists together in Miami during Art Basel to discuss the state of NFTs. Here’s what we learned.
nodes.subtitle: 22 artists gathered at MetaMask’s inaugural Artist Potluck for an unforgettable evening.

nodes.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: November 2022
nodes.subtitle: More about LavaMoat, an argument for Snow JS, and a great chat on how MetaMask Snaps will be great for self custody!

nodes.title: MetaMask and Laconic Launch MobyMask Light Client
nodes.subtitle: MobyMask, a new initiative from the MetaMask team to help proactively protect users from phishing, uses a dynamic web of trust for sourcing phishing reporters.

nodes.title: MetaMask Launches Bridge Aggregator In Dapp To Easily Move Tokens Across Chains
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask Bridges (beta) aggregates the best routes with time, cost, and security considerations for a better bridging experience.

nodes.title: How We Selected Bridge Providers for MetaMask Bridges
nodes.subtitle: We did extensive research to vet these bridges, with the goal of developing an objective framework to select those that met our high bar for security and decentralization.

nodes.title: Revoke Snap: Revoking Leftover Approvals On ERC20 Token Contracts
nodes.subtitle: An ETHWarsaw Hackathon Snap that allows users to revoke leftover contract approvals.

nodes.title: Aleph Zero Snap: Onboarding Web3 Users to Aleph Zero Network
nodes.subtitle: A MetaMask Snap that onboards users to the Aleph Zero network

nodes.title: Snapshot Snap: Custom Notifications For On-chain Activities
nodes.subtitle: “MetaMask Snaps is the obvious future of web3.” thinks Minci, an independent developer who built the Snapshot, a MetaMask Snap that allows users to set up their own custom notifications for on-chain activities.

nodes.title: Building an extensible world with MetaMask Grants DAO
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask Grants DAO, funded by ConsenSys, is an experimental, employee-led program that issues grants to external developers worldwide to build impactful experiences within the MetaMask ecosystem.

nodes.title: Using LavaMoat To Solve Software Supply Chain Security
nodes.subtitle: LavaMoat is a set of security tools for any JavaScript app to mitigate software supply risks.

nodes.title: Understanding and Avoiding Crypto Honeypot Scams
nodes.subtitle: So-called "honeypot" scams are a constant on the internet, and are on the rise in the crypto ecosystem.

nodes.title: MetaMask's Community At The Core Of Its Growth

nodes.title: How Did MetaMask Come To Life? The Origin Story, Revealed
nodes.subtitle: Take a look at MetaMask's founder portraits to learn more about the minds behind the world's leading self-custodial wallet.

nodes.title: How to Manage Multiple Wallets with MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: If you’re new to Web3, you might still be getting used to using MetaMask and managing your new online identity and assets.

nodes.title: MetaMask Integrates StarkWare Into First-Of-Its-Kind ZK-Rollup Snap
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask Snaps allows developers to expand the capabilities of MetaMask and enable a myriad of features, including connecting to non-EVM networks like StarkNet.

nodes.title: ConsenSys and StarkWare Partner to Bring ZK-Rollups to Infura and MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: ConsenSys and StarkWare are bringing ZK-rollups to MetaMask and Infura to give developers more network options for a multi-chain future.
